Tweet Text: This morning, the Toronto Board of Health unanimously approved a motion calling on the Province to publicly release all the advice and recommendations that the Ontario Cabinet and Chief Medical Officer of Health receive from the provincial COVID-19 advisory tables.

NEW: Toronto Board of Health unanimously approved motion calling on province to publicly release "confidential" advice provided to the Chief Medical Officer of Health, cabinet by the provincial #COVID19 advisory tables, including the Public Health Measures Table.

A brief statement from Dr. Shelley Deeks, Public Health Ontario's chief health protection officer, who took the rare step of speaking out against the province's #COVID19 plan, which had thresholds that were 2-4x higher than what her agency recommended. https://t.co/zh6ADOzAQf

SCOOP: The province rejected its own public health agency's advice when it launched its framework for #COVID19 restrictions. A member of the health measures table didn't see the final plan until it was publicly released.
